info.headline: Hard Freeze Warning issued January 15 at 3:40AM CST until January 15 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...HARD FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...HARD FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Hard Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 18. For the second Hard Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 13 expected. * WHERE...Houston, Trinity, Madison, Walker, Burleson, Brazos, Washington and Grimes Counties. * WHEN...For the first Hard Freeze Warning, until 10 AM CST this morning. For the second Hard Freeze Warning, from midnight tonight to 9 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will climb into the low to upper 30s on Tuesday; however, sub freezing temperatures are again expected Tuesday night into Wednesday. Therefore, the Hard Freeze Warning will remain in effect through early Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
